channel.title: 华尔街日报
channel.description: 这是一个追踪华尔街日报news的种子

item.title: 尼基-黑利（Nikki Haley）证明了相当一部分共和党初选选民并不支持唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）再次获得提名，无论这看起来多么不可避免，@mollyesque 写道
item.description:
Nikki Haley is demonstrating how a sizable portion of the Republican primary electorate isn’t on board with another Donald Trump nomination, no matter how inevitable it seems, @mollyesque writes https://t.co/EBTWWga4OU https://t.co/EBTWWga4OU

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) February 26, 2024

item.title: 宜家收购了一系列购物中心，并表示将通过联合办公空间和北欧美食为这一陷入困境的业态注入新的活力
item.description:
IKEA has bought a string of malls and says it can breathe new life into the troubled format, with co-working spaces and Nordic cuisine https://t.co/XgR5XQSMQQ https://t.co/XgR5XQSMQQ

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) February 26, 2024

item.title: 投资者正重新涌向生物技术领域。其中最大的赢家是在癌症和减肥等热门研究领域进行药物开发的初创公司。
item.description:
Investors are flocking back to biotech. Among the big winners: startups chasing drug development in hot research areas like cancer and weight loss. https://t.co/VXDfoAXomQ https://t.co/VXDfoAXomQ

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) February 26, 2024

item.title: 铁路运营商诺福克南方公司（Norfolk Southern）正计划更新董事会，以抵御股东活动团体发起的代理权争夺战。
item.description:
Railroad operator Norfolk Southern is planning a board refresh as it seeks to fend off a shareholder-activist group waging a proxy battle https://t.co/P1Nebhj53D https://t.co/P1Nebhj53D

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) February 26, 2024

item.title: 在围绕工作文化的永无止境的讨论中，关于清晨会议的争论也愈演愈烈。早上 8 点开会可以吗？
item.description:
Debates over early-morning meetings have flared up in the never-ending discussion around work culture. Are 8 a.m. meetings ever OK? https://t.co/nngMIIueD9 https://t.co/nngMIIueD9

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) February 26, 2024

item.title: 明迪-卡灵（Mindy Kaling）通过讲述她在成长过程中没有在电视上看到的妇女和女孩的故事，建立了一个娱乐帝国。在这里，她谈到了自己的日常锻炼、单亲妈妈的身份以及安妮-海瑟薇教给她的 "正念"。
item.description:
Mindy Kaling has built an entertainment empire on the stories of women and girls she didn’t see on TV growing up. Here, she discusses her exercise routine, being a single mom and what Anne Hathaway taught her about mindfulness. https://t.co/MsBwzh4loU https://t.co/MsBwzh4loU

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) February 26, 2024

item.title: 乌克兰士兵 Alen Dudnik 十年前开始与俄罗斯作战。曾与他会面的《世界日报》记者与他取得了联系。
item.description:
Ukrainian soldier Alen Dudnik started fighting Russia a decade ago. A WSJ reporter who met him then gets back in touch. https://t.co/eeCBylA1T4 https://t.co/eeCBylA1T4

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) February 26, 2024

item.title: 美国总统拜登正在召集国会领导人前往白宫，因为政府部分关门的时间已在周五晚上滴答作响，而乌克兰援助计划仍被搁置。
item.description:
President Biden is calling congressional leaders to the White House as the clock ticks toward a partial government shutdown Friday night and a Ukraine aid package remains stuck https://t.co/dYfiXYh5Jf https://t.co/dYfiXYh5Jf

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) February 26, 2024

item.title: 观看：自 2 月中旬以来，数以千计的农民包围了印度首都新德里，并在抗议活动中与警方发生冲突。华尔街日报》的特里皮-拉希里（Tripti Lahiri）解释了这场骚乱及其对即将到来的选举的影响。
item.description:
Watch: Thousands of farmers have surrounded India’s capital New Delhi and clashed with police in protests since mid-February. The WSJ’s Tripti Lahiri explains the unrest and how it could affect upcoming elections. https://t.co/fuG7BNGamD https://t.co/fuG7BNGamD

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) February 26, 2024

item.title: 巴勒斯坦权力机构政府辞职，这是朝着美国和中东大国视为战后巴勒斯坦权力机构接管加沙的一个条件的全面改革迈出的早期一步。
item.description:
The Palestinian Authority’s government resigned, an early step toward the overhauls the U.S. and Middle Eastern powers see as a condition for the body to take charge of Gaza after the war https://t.co/iwC3t6zVVS https://t.co/iwC3t6zVVS

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) February 26, 2024

item.title: 街谈巷议特姆可能会抢占亚马逊的市场份额，但其他在线市场可能最终会受到连带损害
item.description:
Heard on the Street: Temu may be going after Amazon’s market share, but other online marketplaces could end up sustaining collateral damage https://t.co/7Bu3H7ms61 https://t.co/7Bu3H7ms61

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) February 26, 2024

item.title: 安东尼-金（Anthony Kim）曾是美巡赛的超新星，直到他 26 岁从赛场上消失。他与 LIV Golf 的回归将解答这项运动最大的谜团之一：他还厉害吗？
item.description:
Anthony Kim was a PGA Tour supernova until he disappeared from the game at age 26. His return with LIV Golf will answer one of the sport’s biggest mysteries: Is he still any good? https://t.co/bG6lTIVOtr https://t.co/bG6lTIVOtr

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) February 26, 2024

item.title: 对于沃伦-巴菲特（Warren Buffett）的伯克希尔-哈撒韦公司（Berkshire Hathaway）来说，日本股票一直是神话般的赌注。这些股票的回报率使 S&P 500 指数和日本日经 225 指数相形见绌。
item.description:
Japanese stocks have been fabulous bets for Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway. Their returns have dwarfed those of the S&P 500 and Japan’s Nikkei 225 stock average. https://t.co/gYX6JDLlZV https://t.co/gYX6JDLlZV

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) February 26, 2024

item.title: "我童年所有梦想和噩梦的可怕融合"@JasonGay 解决了美国职业棒球大联盟 2024 年春训的意外危机：球员对透视制服的抱怨。
item.description:
“A terrifying fusion of all my childhood dreams and nightmares.” @JasonGay tackles the unexpected crisis of Major League Baseball’s Spring Training 2024: player complaints about see-through uniforms. https://t.co/HLxfeGRTAd https://t.co/HLxfeGRTAd

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) February 26, 2024

item.title: 我们的记者冒着售罄的嘉年华邮轮的危险，来确定拥挤的邮轮是否会带来度假灾难。他是如何充分利用这次旅行的。
item.description:
Our reporter braved a sold-out Carnival cruise to determine whether a crowded ship is a recipe for a vacation disaster. Here’s how he managed to make the most of his trip. https://t.co/aNrW7rPMfM https://t.co/aNrW7rPMfM

item.title: 民主党人警告拜登总统要认真对待周二密歇根州的初选结果，因为活动人士正在推动他改变在以色列与哈马斯战争问题上的路线
item.description:
Democrats are warning President Biden to take Tuesday’s Michigan primary results seriously, as activists push him to change course on the war between Israel and Hamas https://t.co/hSE5p9zOjX https://t.co/hSE5p9zOjX

item.title: 为自己留出时间会对你的事业和人际关系产生积极影响。专栏作家 Rachel Feintzeig 说，因此，在你的生活中为有趣的事情留出更多的空间。
item.description:
Carving out time for yourself can have positive effects on your career and relationships. So make more space in your life for the fun stuff, says columnist Rachel Feintzeig. https://t.co/9ziHg4Bef8 https://t.co/9ziHg4Bef8

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) February 26, 2024

item.title: 过去十年间，三星电子的李在镕曾两次身陷囹圄，共度过了大约 560 天。现在他已经摆脱了法律纠纷，这位电子巨头的下一步会是什么？
item.description:
Samsung's Lee Jae-yong spent roughly 560 days behind bars in two separate stints during the past decade. Now that he's free of legal problems, what’s next for the electronics titan? https://t.co/CwvyLcs02p https://t.co/CwvyLcs02p

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) February 26, 2024

item.title: 我们毁了性爱吗？五位作家提出了一个问题：在人类最亲密的行为方面，社会是否已经迷失了方向？
item.description:
Have we ruined sex? Five writers ask whether society has lost its way when it comes to the most intimate of human acts. https://t.co/aE7kraOicm https://t.co/aE7kraOicm

item.title: 难以捉摸的 Cybertruck 是历史上首次亮相的最两极分化的汽车之一。但实际驾驶起来是什么感觉呢？我们的汽车专栏作家丹-尼尔（Dan Neil）试驾了 48 小时，一探究竟。
item.description:
The elusive Cybertruck is one of the most polarizing vehicle debuts in history. But what’s it like to actually drive one? Our car columnist Dan Neil thrashed around in one for 48 hours to find out. https://t.co/cPnrZBueo5 https://t.co/cPnrZBueo5

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) February 26, 2024

item.title: 把奖杯戴在手腕上会让你立刻被认为自命不凡。为什么您的下一款强力腕表应该是一款谦逊的炫耀之作？
item.description:
